title: CNN and Fox news

content: quote: Originally posted by Wolfhound_1968: Just a question for all you know it alls. Where do you get your information ? I’ll go there. I use the front page of Google News, for starters. In addition, there's a website called world-newspapers.com where you can get English versions of newspapers from around the world. I occasionally read op-eds, but not very often. Among them, my favorites are Paul Krugman's weekly in the New York Times, and William Pfaff's stuff (he has his own website). And as I read, I do a lot of fact-checking. I give the online media/newspapers about a 70% accuracy rate (if they report a story correctly), and pundit-heavy American television news about (at best) a 30% accuracy rate. They don't seem to be concerned with accuracy, though. So, instead of sitting in front of a TV, I'm either spending time with my wife or reading. We often read stuff we find to each other and talk about it.
quote: Originally posted by Wolfhound_1968: Just a question for all you know it alls. Where do you get your information ? I’ll go there.
reply: I use the front page of Google News, for starters. In addition, there's a website called world-newspapers.com where you can get English versions of newspapers from around the world. I occasionally read op-eds, but not very often. Among them, my favorites are Paul Krugman's weekly in the New York Times, and William Pfaff's stuff (he has his own website). And as I read, I do a lot of fact-checking. I give the online media/newspapers about a 70% accuracy rate (if they report a story correctly), and pundit-heavy American television news about (at best) a 30% accuracy rate. They don't seem to be concerned with accuracy, though. So, instead of sitting in front of a TV, I'm either spending time with my wife or reading. We often read stuff we find to each other and talk about it.
